datafield.subfield: 131-138 x 104 mm. bound to 146 x 115 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 996
Origin: Lacks dated scribal colophon ; likely copied in Egypt in the 1930s and bound for James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974). Some sections perhaps copied earlier.
Former shelfmark: Mich. Isl. Ms. temp. no. 145

Binding: Boards covered in dark green cloth with dark green leather over spine (quarter binding) ; pastedowns and flyleaves in wove paper printed with a floral vegetal pattern in green ; spine gold-stamped with title and decorative accents over raised bands "شرح هياكل النور الاصفهانى | J.H.D." ; sewn in white thread over two recessed cords ; stuck-on endbands (blue and white stripe) ; overall in fairly good condition.

Support: Machine wove paper of at least a few types, as well as machine laid paper with watermark of "GOUVERNEMENT EGYPTIEN" with star and crescent at center and other smaller crescents with three stars (see pp.117-122, 131-136, etc. and compare Walz, "The Paper trade of Egypt and the Sudan," p.91), and wove ledger / grid paper (see pp.123-130).
Decoration: Headings and keywords (often text being commented upon) rubricated ; otherwise text executed mainly in blue or black ink.

Script: Naskh with influence of ruqʻah ; modern hand in a medium to bold line ; mainly serifless with effect of tilt to the left, very slight effect of words descending to baseline, free assimilation of letters, curvilinear descenders, open and closed counters, pointing in strokes or conjoined dots (occasionally oriented vertically), final yāʼ usually unpointed ; some sections in ruqʻah.
Layout: Written in 13-16 lines per page.

Collation: i, 7 IV(56), I (58), 2 V(78), VI (90), V (100), 2 IV(116), 4 (120), 2 V(140), i ; chiefly quaternions ; pagination in blue or black ink, Hindu-Arabic numerals, each section numbered distinctly ; pages between some sections left fully or partially blank (see pp.43-49, 115-117, 200-201) ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (pagination skips from 219 to 300, so is thereafter off by 80 pages).

Explicit: "جمع بطريق عموم المجاز اذ لا مؤثر في الحقيقة الا هو كما مر والله اعلم تمت انوار الهيكل الخامس من هياكل النور السهروردية بشرح الجلال الدواني الصديقي نورنا الله بانوار العلم والعرفان وتوجنا بتاج البهجة والبهاء والايقان انه سميع مجيب الدعوات مفيض الخير والبركات بل هو غاية الغايات ونهاية النهايات وتمام التمامات"
Incipit: "يا من نصب رايات آيات قدرته على كواهل هياكل الممكنات واودع اسرار حكمته في قوابل شواكل الكائنات ... اما بعد فهذا ايها الذكي المتوقد شرح لهياكل النور يحاكي بحسن دقائقه شواكل الحور ..."

Walz, Terence. "The Paper trade of Egypt and the Sudan in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries and its re-export to the Bilad as-Sudan." In The Trans-Saharan book trade: manuscript culture, Arabic literacy, and intellectual history in Muslim Africa. Graziano Krätli and Ghislaine Lydon, Eds. (Leiden : Brill, 2011):
Lambton, A.K.S. "al-Dawānī, Muḥammad b. Asʿad Ḏj̲alāl al-Dīn." In EI2,

Careful copy of the commentary by Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Asʻad al-Dawānī (d.1502 or 3) on Shihāb al-Dīn Yaḥyá ibn Ḥabash al-Suhrawardī's (d.1191) Hayākil al-nūr, with opening and then separate sections for the fourth, fifth , and sixth hayākil.

On upper pastedown, label with ex libris of James Heyworth-Dunne (d.1974), stamped with inventory number, "Ex Libris | J. Heyworth-Dunne | D. Lit. (London) | No. 7940" ; UM Library inscription on p.3 "Dunning | Heyworth-Dunne | 6-13-51 | 71955" ; possible former inventory mark "231/55" on verso of final leaf (p."360") ; occasional glosses and marginal corrections.
